cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.NE. 

The paper introduces a conversational agent architecture for a specific knowledge domain, which falls under the natural language processing (NLP) field. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of machine learning techniques, which suggests the possibility of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) being a relevant sub-category. The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) and language generation (LG) techniques, which could make cs.IR and cs.LG possible sub-categories. Finally, the paper mentions the use of feedback to improve the conversational agent, which could involve reinforcement learning techniques, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category as well.
